page.title: 03LEY FARM
page.content: MR. KING OWNS LEY FARM WHICH IS A MIXED FARM, SITUATED IN THE SOUTH-EAST CORNER OF OUR D-BLOCK ON THE SEVERN PLAIN. HE OWNS 208 ACRES AND IT IS SPREAD BETWEEN 17 FIELDS. HE HAS 11 FIELDS OF PERMANENT GRASS, 6 FIELDS OF GRASS FOR MOWING AND 3 FIELDS FOR GROWING WHEAT, BARLEY AND OATS. FERTILIZING IS MINIMAL. DRAINAGE IS A PROBLEM ON THE PLAIN, DITCHES AND PIPES BEING THE DRAINAGE METHODS USED. IT IS MAINLY A DAIRY FARM WITH 30 FRIESIAN AND 90 HEREFORD COWS. GLOUCESTER IS HIS LOCAL CATTLE MARKET AND HE SENDS HIS MILK TO STONEHOUSE. HIS CROPS ARE USED FOR STOCK FEED. HIS MACHINERY CONSISTS OF 5 TRACTORS, A BAILER, HAY-MAKING MACHINERY AND ONE COMBINE HARVESTER. HE HAS 2 MEN WORKING FOR HIM. DEBBIE LEPPARD AGE 11
